column2: NEBRASKA DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column6: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column8: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 3. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column6: speed up to beat the train.
column8: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
column10: yield to all trains at the crossing.

column2: 4. A yellow arrow means:
column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a steady yellow light.

column2: 5. What does BAC stand for?
6. This road sign means:
7. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.

column2: 8. You are driving on a four-lane divided highway, two vehicles are driving side by side ahead of you, and you are in a hurry. You should:
column4: drive closely behind the vehicle in the left lane and flash your headlights.
column6: drive in either lane with at least a two-second time interval behind the vehicle ahead.
column8: drive closely behind the vehicle in the right lane.
column10: drive closely behind the vehicles ahead changing lanes frequently.

column2: 9. Failure to secure children ages 6-18 in a safety belt or child safety seat is punishable by:
column4: two points assessed against your driving record.
column6: a fine and one point assessed against your driving record.

column2: 10. When you see vehicles entering the interstate from an entrance ramp to your right, you should:
column6: signal and move to the left to allow them a smooth, safe entry, if safe.
column8: increase your speed to beat the vehicles that are on the entrance ramp.

column2: 11. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column8: It helps increase your stopping distance.

13. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
14. This sign means:
column10: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 15. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
16. This road sign means:
17. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column6: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column8: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column10: must make a U-turn and then turn right.

column2: 18. In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
column6: drive a few MPH slower than most.
column8: drive a few MPH faster than most.

column2: 19. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
20. This road sign means:
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 21. A diamond-shaped sign is a:
22. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Watch for vehicles entering from the side
column8: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed

column2: 24. When you see this sign you should stop and:
column4: yield the right-of way to all vehicles that arrive after you.
column6: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.
column8: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
column10: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.

column2: 25. Most signs used in street work areas are:
